definition[0]: while waiting for something, or until something happens
example[0]: Sales of the drug have been stopped, pending further research.
example[1]: Many trade disputes are pending, awaiting the outcome of the talks.
definition[2]: something that is pending is going to happen soon
example[3]: A decision has been delayed pending further inquiries.
example[4]: Two lawsuits remain pending against the company.
example[5]: If a company has applied for a patent, it can put ‘ patent pending ’ on the product it wants to patent.
example[6]: The bank said its poor performance would not affect its pending merger.
definition[3]: a place for putting papers, letters etc that have not yet been dealt with
example[7]: The messages have all been placed in his pending file.
